lexUnit.name: tired.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: in need of rest or sleep.

sentence.text: It was cold , it would soon be dark , and the dogs were tired -- they 'd be following soon .
The truth was that every one of them was tired .
His face was tired , and wet with rain .
The sergeant thought Blanche would be tired after the tension of the previous hour or two , and he expected Blanche to sit at her desk quietly for a few minutes .
Because she was tired , she fumbled slightly as she tried to get the key to turn in the lock .
I 'm pretty tired now .
` I was pretty tired after the first lot , " said Catalina .
The voice was so absent and tired that it took some of the chill from the words .
` I 'm so tired I 'm deaf , " and he fell asleep .
If she were n't so tired she would be angry with him , except that it was difficult to remain angry with a man who had saved her life .
And when Boy got home to his bed he was too tired to sleep or to speak .
He found he was too tired to unbutton his doublet .
Killion trudged it with a kind of dogged stupidity , too tired to think after the all-day violence .
At this time I was often very tired , because I was pregnant .
It may also be useful in case the patient becomes unexpectedly tired , and needs to sit down for a moment .
I became very tired and soon felt I could not swim any more .
But I feel terribly tired and completely lacking in self-confidence .
Then , realising that Matt required an answer , she said , ` I 'm feeling a little tired , that 's all . "
When they got home , Dorothy was very tired and she had a bad bruise on her forearm and another on her cheek .
He would stop before he got tired .
She looked desperately tired , but there were no obvious marks of grief on her face .
His face was now white , and he looked tired and ill .
His tired eyes watched her walk to a vacant place at the corner of the bar , but he did n't show any surprise at her departure and made no attempt to pursue her .
It was an intelligent , brave smile , lighting up her thin face and her tired grey eyes .
Her tired eyes pleaded with the coroner .
The day shift was coming up into the twilight , miners with tired and miserable faces trooping out , their clothes as tattered as those of the miners in the Borinage .
Framing her tired little face with his warm palms , he dropped a kiss on her exquisite nose .
A tired smile flickers across her face .
At the other extreme , a sick or tired horse will display a very low carriage , with his tail drooping and his head and neck very low .
The tired horse stopped dead in its tracks and turned its head around to give him a baleful stare .
He gives me his tired look .
She noticed suddenly how tired he looked ; weariness had taken some of the sparkle from those blue eyes .
` Yes , " sighed Menzies in a tired voice .
She was glad to see Alice , began talking in a heavy tired voice about how the old woman had her running up and down the stairs , even got her up in the middle of the night .
In a thin , tired voice he welcomed his friend .
` A man can be dead tired after a week 's work but he can still give his wife a helping hand .
` I 'm still rather tired after the birth , " she admitted , ` but I 'm getting stronger . "
Edward Siegel , tired after the operation , explained to Cowley that , ` His system is basically dormant .
` What is it you want ? " she asked , tired from the flight .
Ben climbed them slowly , tired from the long row back .
They kissed , and Felicity fell fast asleep , tired from her journey .
She was a very small woman , and she was often tired because of the children .
Our dad loves walking over the fields when he comes home tired from working in the city .
Conservative landslide : I stand on my doorstep wearing a tired grin , hair boyishly tousled , while a group of neighbours points hand-held tape recorders at me respectfully .
He was a striking figure , a tired giant in golden armour .
He let out a tired sigh .
I was rather tired , and everything seemed black .
The Chief Warden returned to his office tired , worried and upset .
I was really tired afterwards .
You seem quite tired and nervy ; not at all the way you were last time : very trim and self-contained .
In 1923 , Turkey broke away from the tired Ottoman rulers , and Kemal Ataturk rose to power on a wave of popular support .
